intro: Zunilia hyalina, commonly known as the glassy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the stems are often hairy. Zunilia hyalina is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
